result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher R. Danner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases 15CF341 and 15CM357 called together at 2:05pm [mo]
Defendant Christopher R. Danner in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel 
On Case 15CM357, Count #1 and On Case 15CF341, Counts #1 and #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--On Case 15CF341, Count #2: to serve 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on  3/21/16 at  6:00pm.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
 per Agent

--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--complete certified Batterers' Intervention programming
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--no contact with any known drug offenders unless Agent approves or for therapeutic purposes, the Court makes an exception as to Ms. Leaman contact is allowed via electronic means regarding issues related to the co-parenting of the child they have in common and for purposes of any child exchange
--to pay statutory court costs, to include $100 domestic abuse surcharge
--to pay $50 drug testing fees
--to provide DNA sample upon demand

The Court reminds Mr. Danner to report for his jail sentence without any alcohol or controlled substances in his system

Sentencing hearing at 03-04-2016 02:00 pm
with elements and criminal case settlement

Cases 15CF341 and 15CM357 called together at 12:30pm {mo]
Defendant Christopher R. Danner in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered Count #1 of Case 15CM357 and Counts #1 and #2 of Case 15CF341; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses remaining counts of Cases 15CM357 and 15CF341 .

The Court directs Atty. Huebner to contact the Court's JA by 1/29/16 at 4:00pm to schedule a Sentencing hearing.
